ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you've got enough Arabic, definitely take it.
I would definitely recommend it. It was a great class and I learned a lot about the topic.

This was a wonderful course, with an exceptionally great professor. The readings each week were fascinating, and the workload entirely appropriate for the reward of getting through them. Stephen Davis is a great professor and a great man, and knows exactly how to teach the material for this class in a way that is fun, thorough and rewarding.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I had no knowledge of Christian Arabic Lit. and Theology prior to the course, and it gave me a great framework with insight into specific instances of authors.
This class improved my ability with Arabic texts, which is exactly what I wanted.
I am an undergraduate, without a firm discipline or dissertation in mind, but this class certainly changed the way I will pursue my future studies, and possibly even my long term post-graduate plans.
